www.nzpolo.com recreation/sports this document requires a browser that can view frames click here to view the page polo and passion the two go hand in hand it s always been like that for me when as a young man i tackled polo head on i put all my energy into the game training my own ponies and building my skills my determination paid dividends i have played professionally all over the world and represented new zealand at international level i sometimes cannot believe that this great game has taken me so many places and allowed me to play with and against so many fantastic people the polo school has two vacancies each new zealand season for gap year students it s a great opportunity for young promising players to hone their polo skills over the southern hemisphere summer while at the same time expanding their horizons new zealand is a friendly safe country and the south island has some of the world s most spectacular scenery our school is just 15 minutes from christchurch a cosmopolitan city of more than 350 000 people with a wide array of entertainment and night life we typically take gap students from about september when the local season begins to crank up if you re interested in one of these positions please let us know 98 121 32 101 109 97 105 108 demand for these placements is high so please register your interest as soon as possible there is more information on our gap year page i intend to be in britain around july which could well provide an opportunity to meet with interested students today i like to think i am giving something back to the game that has given me so much the final part of my polo dream has fallen into place my polo school with its playing field stables and purpose built facilities welcomes players from all over the world whether they are beginners experienced players wanting to sharpen their game or gap year students looking to broaden their horizons the school is right beside our home purpose built with quality guest quarters to house the polo students the school s training programme has evolved over 12 years into one that not only gets results but gets results quickly not just for the aspiring professional but also for novices intent on learning the game i also pride myself on the quality of my polo ponies which with the low new zealand dollar prove to be very competitively priced on the international market my ponies have been exported all over the globe thank you for visiting our website it lays out everything you need to know about polo down under whatever you do never lose sight of your dreams if polo is your passion i d love to see you at the school mark harris facilities the school gap year testimonials r r pony sales about us contact us links guestbook home site by

www.polomallets.com recreation/sports nano s custom made mallets professional and prompt mallet repair service wood heads wide selection of canes we supply cane grips heads for repair custom colors on request light mallets for women children arena and bikes new mallets in stock open year around 3500 fairlane farms road suite 6 west palm beach fl 800 903 nano 6266 tel 561 793 4911 fax 561 793 4714 adriano nano nano perez started manufacturing and repairing polo mallets in his native country argentina mendoza 1969 he moved to the united states in 1988 and has earned an unrivaled reputation for his superior excellence he established nano 146 s polo mallets inc in 1993 in wellington florida custom made mallets are our specialty we have plenty of mallets in stock that meet the needs of our clients the world over nano travels to asia and argentina carefully selecting the best canes and highest quality materials available nano commonly known as the world s best repairman send your broken or old mallets and they will return like new making a polo mallet the finest polo mallets share a common heritage they originate from a special cane which grows in the rain forests of asia and an unusual tree found only in a certain area of south america unlike ordinary bamboo which prepared mallet canes resemble the thorny stalks used for polo mallets come from a cane called a thorny member of the palm family snaking its way through the jungle in search of sunlight this cane reaches 600 feet after 15 years although mature the cane is still considered young by asian government standards for protection of the species making harvesting of the smaller diameter cane needed for polo mallets difficult once selected and determined mature the cane is cut near the root where it is strongest nine foot lengths are boiled in coconut and diesel oil for 10 15 minutes until yellow then washed in a mixture of sand and water when clean the canes are bundled and stacked to dry to the familiar shades of gold and beige when the mallet maker receives his canes he must heat them over an open fire to straighten them then cure the lengths in a special oven the length of time for the curing is critical to the strength and durability of a cane and is determined by the weight of each as polo players have different preferences regarding flexibility and weight of their mallets some prefer to select their own canes before they are attached to the mallet head because the best mallets are carefully balanced it is critical that cane and head be compatible in terms of weight finally the cane is attached to the mallet head a cigar shaped piece of wood cut from the tree an unusually durable close grained variety found only in northern argentina and parts of brazil and paraguay you are the visitor

www.applewood-farm.com/ recreation/sports applewood farm a full time dressage training facility provides a secluded quiet atmosphere for rider and horse to learn and train together our training facility includes a perma flex all weather outdoor dressage arena a covered arena 10 acres of lush pasture and accommodations for 20 horses applewood farm established in 1986 was initially a 15 stall barn and was home to all sorts of hunters jumpers dressage and driving horses expanded to 20 stalls in 1990 dressage began to be the central theme among the clientele when michelle gibson first boarded her horses here in 1992 by 1994 applewood was hosting its first olympic fundraiser for michelle and peron was living in stall number 1 following the 1996 olympics as more and more horses came in for training our boarding program shifted to become exclusively dressage training since opening its doors in 1986 applewood farm has always provided excellent care for horses today we are proud to provide excellent training as well home horses for sale tour michelle gibson products jobs boarding rates contact us last updated july 2000 url designed and developed by a9 copyright 1999 2000 communication design solutions all rights reserved horses for sale facility tour products applewood photo job opportunities contact us boarding rates newsletter about us applewood foundation home welcome to applewood farm fulltime dressage training facility home horses for sale facility tour michelle gibson products job opportunities boarding rates newsletter about us applewood foundation contact us applewood farm url designed and developed by a9 copyright 2001 2003 communication design solutions all rights reserved
www.naturalsporthorse.com/ recreation/sports the natural training articles clinics and clinicians tom dorrance contact us links welcome to our home page we are an association of like minded trainers instructors clinicians riders handlers and owners with a sincere interest in building harmonious and in depth relationships with our horses we promote a mindful and respectful approach to the handling and training of sporthorses an approach oftentimes referred to as natural horsemanship because many of us compete in disciplines which demand the utmost response flexibility and athleticism from our horses we recognize that tension strain discomfort and injuries are the accepted norm and too often not even recognized in an effort to redirect this trend a primary mission of ours is to promote and encourage a greater awareness of the potential for true unity between horse and human within the competitive dressage hunter jumper and combined training disciplines an endeavor we feel is rather timely and unique please browse through the links in the side column which provide you with information on all of our services and more webdesign by terry church 169 copyright 2005

www.sprucemeadows.com recreation/sports spruce meadows is located in the foothills of the majestic canadian rockies within the city of calgary alberta this picturesque complex has captivated the worldwide audience of the sport of show jumping there is no other place like it spruce meadows blends the discipline of sport with the communication of international commerce and the goodwill of visitors.. bringing canada together with the world spruce meadows tournaments have attracted virtually every olympic world european and national show jumping champion but there is more than just athletic excitement and excellence at spruce meadows there is also a quiet side to spruce meadows the peace and tranquility of the country is for some even more enjoyable from sunrise to sunset the splendour of alberta awaits you to discover explore spruce meadows where the coffee pot is always on and a warm smile from our friendly staff will always welcome you 365 days of the year home contact us history directions links job opportunities bus schedules upcoming events send mail to with questions or comments copyright a9 1998 2005 spruce meadows all rights reserved do not duplicate or redistribute in any form

www.on-target-training.com/ recreation/sports you can train your horse to do anything what s shawna doing with this whale our sponsors clicker training and beyond.. on target training by shawna brings a new and proven technique for training to the equine industry used by professionals and olympic caliber riders on target training is a reward reinforcement training system that dramatically accelerates the training process for any breed by unleashing a horse s natural desire to perform what results is an incredible bond between human and horse a partnership based on success the basic starting tools are a small hand held clicker a hand held target and a waist mounted container of food desired behavior is reinforced with a click followed immediately with a reward reinforcement a target is added to give direction and improve focus step by step you and your horse develop better communication and increased motivation your horse can then learn new behaviors motivated by its own desire to perform shipping problems we have been experiencing shipping difficulties with our products recently we are aware of the problem and hope to have all orders fulfilled and shipped out within the next month we apologize for the inconvenience thank you for your patience how we began training method publicity products services q a resources contact us on target training shawna 817 circle 212 carlsbad ca 92008 phone in the us and canada call toll free 800 638 call 1 760 720 6112 fax 760 720 6119 e mail on target training is a u.s registered trademark this site was designed by reeves digital development

www.craigperformancehorses.com/ recreation/sports our history and craig performance horses started in the late 40 8217 s with floyd 8220 fat 8221 craig riding three and five gaited horses which were the rage at that time in 1951 fat went to kings ranch in texas and brought back two sonny sensation and honey 1951 was also the year that the raider owned by farms in austin indiana became the worlds champion parade horse fat craig was the trainer the 2nd generation of horse trainers mike craig was featured in the first quarter horse journal as a 16 year old trainer and top youth aqha rider in 1961 during the next twenty years mike rode two year olds and a small amount of show horses cory craig carried on the tradition of winners by riding donnas catalyst to lead the world in 1989 in the junior working cow horse event our motto has always been honesty integrity and to give the customer their money 8217 s worth craig performance horses evolved from 12 stalls to 60 stalls and is located 30 miles north of louisville kentucky today 8217 s operation focuses on four basic areas our core business is starting two year olds which we do in excess of 100 annually our 2nd area is reining and working cow horses the third area is centered around recreational riders and the 4th is lessons at all levels in the western discipline our family each involved in some capacity in our business is mike linda craig david jennifer craig and cory michelle chance craig cutter cook joined our operation in 2004 and is the assistant trainer to cory craig and also manages the barn operations the gals in the family take care of the daily administrative activity provide moral support and live with a lot of late nights and weekends at the barn and shows all rights reserved by craig performance horses if you have questions or comments about this website click here to contact the webmaster

gambling breeder s cup history from the time wild again slew o gold and gate dancer dueled down the lane together in the first breeders cup classic in 1984 the race has lived up to its billing as the showcase race on a showcase day of racing strategically placed as the last of the seven cup races a certain amount of dramatic tension is built up each year on cup day as the day winds its way to the classic rarely does the race let racing fans down.. more.. whether it s a particular race or a series of events bet horse tracks has great odds for your breeder s cup gambling pleasure kentucky derby history past winners track info stats trophy preakness stakes history past winners track info stats trophy belmont stakes history past winners track info stats trophy breeder s cup gambling action for the year s most important horseracing event find the best sign up bonuses horse gambling promotions and odds for over 80 racetracks in the us steeplechase horse racing virginia gold cup every year thousands of steeplechase enthusiasts converge on the plains virginia to attend the annual virginia gold cup races this challenging race over timber is one of the most distinguished events in america and has been held in fauquier county since 1922 more.. looking for a reliable service to help you with your breeder s cup gambling bet jockey gives you everything you need sign up now and ask about our special bonuses and promotions horse racing posting forum contains discussions on breeder s cup gambling and other events join the forum and start participating today go to forum sports gambling absolute picks rocketman trends weekly football picks ace high babes picks iss sports more.. horse gambling references horse racing luck all race tracks horse racing center thoroughbred gambling horse gambling online xtreme horse racing horse racing guides online racebooks all about races 2 bet on horses more. international horseracing dubai world cup history the group i dubai world cup sponsored by emirates stands alone at the summit of international horse racing as horse racing entered a new era with the changeover of centuries it was the dubai world cup inaugurated in 1996 that paved the way forward more.. history past winners track info trophy melbourne cup history the first melbourne cup held in 1861 was certainly a dramatic event according to legend archer the first horse to win the melbourne cup was reported to have walked 850 km 560 miles from nowra to flemington to be a part of a race that one day would capture the spirit of a nation more.. history past winners track info clinics end of trail equine training is located just 4 miles north of the idaho british columbia border in the beautiful kootenay region of bc click here for map there are only three things we need from our horses performance respect and trust john lyons methods can help you achieve these goals and improve your relationship with your horse owners.. learn how to get respect and trust from your horse how to catch the horse that doesn t want to be caught how to get your horse to lower his head to be bridled how to get your horse to stand tied and stand still to be mounted learn the emergency stop the calm down cue and how to get your horse to be light and responsive learn how to get your horse lighter on the bit improve softness and responsiveness to your aids improve your horse s willingness and cooperation teach your horse the spook in place learn how to break a colt to ride the resistance free way learn how to overcome serious problems like bucking rearing biting or running www.stonyoak.com/ recreation/sports stony oak farm and training center was established by w.e simms in the early 1900 s and was known as tired of sending his horses all over the place to be trained mr simms decided to build his own training center w.e simms developed farm into one of the most prestigious thoroughbred landmarks in the bluegrass today stony oak farm and training center is owned by g james phelps and combines its modern and historical resources to operate as a private training center for clients history home stony oak farm and training center occupies 600 acres in the heart of the bluegrass and has a thoroughbred history dating back to the beginning of the 20th century today the stony oak team utilizes this s diverse offerings to provide breaking and training of thoroughbreds as well as supporting a complete rehabilitation and lay up service for post operative care resting and treatment of lay up horses stony oak farm and training center is nestled in southeastern bourbon county kentucky eight miles north of i 64 within eighty five miles of four major thoroughbred tracks including welcome keeneland turfway river downs churchill downs login password login cancel

www.thinkequus.u-net.com/ recreation/sports viewing this page requires a browser capable of displaying frames welcome to think equus january 2003 it s hard to believe that after the overwhelming success of my first book think like your horse that my second book q a guide to understanding your horse is now on the shelves to buy david and charles the publishers have done another great job of putting it together it was only 1 year ago that think like your horse was launched and it has sold over 23 000 copies worldwide and still doing well i receive letters and phone calls daily from people who have read the book thanking me for opening their eyes and giving them a better way to work with their horse the new book q a guide to understanding your horse looks at different questions that i frequently get asked and i hope that it will help with answering some questions that you may have i am very proud of this book and hope that you will enjoy reading it as much as i did writing it my purpose for writing it was so people have a useful reference to go to if they are having problems or have questions they need answering if you would like a signed copy please order by calling 01865 and we will send one out by return post or click here for details on how to order my new book or for the think like your horse book and video offer think equus think business a catalyst for change i was recently invited by atlantic housing group to speak at their two day employee conference my role involvement for the two days was to demonstrate the benefits of equal partnership and mutual respect in training horses and relate this to the workplace as many of you will know my think equus philosophy is about teaching people to think like horses and horses to think like people it is tht horse and handle work in unison not just adopting the lets show him whose boss attitude on either side this relates closely to the workplace where by gaining individual s respect strong teams are built there were over 300 employees at the conference and they were not expecting to come face to face with a horse but it certainly gave them all something to think about and it will definitely be something they will remember for a long time if you would like more information on think equus think business please contact the office on 01865 or e mail your horse magazine as i am sure that many of you know that i have been writing for your horse magazine for some years now and we still have lots of features that we are putting together i hope you will all continue to enjoy i would like to say a big thank you to your horse for all the support they have given me over the years finally i would like to say a big thank you on behalf of susi and myself to everyone who supported us over the years i hope you enjoy the rest of the site michael peace

development of horses and riders for the sport of combined training goose downs is beautifully situated on 350 acres of rolling hills south of historic santa fe new mexico in a wide valley surrounded by the sangre de cristo mountains to the west and the ortiz mountains to the south the goose downs property features a great variety of terrain ample water and a cool dry climate which favors riding and training throughout the year goose downs specializes in individualized attention and care for its horses and a highly personalized goal oriented program for its riders the size and layout of the farm promotes both a feeling of quality and an intimate nurturing atmosphere which brings outstanding results in the areas of individual growth learning and competitive achievement happy new year www.classicaldressage.com/rd/ritter.html recreation/sports celebrating six years of preserving and promoting the art of classical was formed in 1998 by dr thomas and shana ritter as a means to disseminate information on the heritage and tradition of classical horsemanship it is our mission to preserve and promote the art culture and knowledge of classical riding classical dressage was at its height in the baroque era when european aristocracy could devote their vast time and wealth to the endless pursuit of artistic equitation over the centuries since classical dressage has entered a steady decline and it is now in great risk of extinction most of the greatest masters of the art have died many without leaving their legacy behind the remaining living masters egon von karl are aging and few in numbers time is of the essence this is why it is crucial that together those of us who believe and value the classical principles hold the torch alive and pass it along join us in this very important venture to preserve and promote the integrity of classical horsemanship just as experience dictates to the ballet teacher the length of time necessary to train his students so the horse too needs time to mature into a great dancer this fact cannot be obliterated by seeming successes that supposedly prove the opposite for even if someone should succeed in training a horse to high school level by the age of eight this individual occurrence cannot shake the foundations of the classical art of riding if this dressage horse is completely unsound and unusable by the age of ten alois a ruthlessly condensed training only leads to a general superficiality to travesties of the movements and to a premature of the horse nature cannot be violated alois we invite you to join and participate in our discussion group the group full details are in the discussion groups subscribe to our newsletter is dedicated to the preservation and promotion of the art of classical dressage contact us phone mailing address 1301 ne highway 272 mcminnville oregon email us.. shana ritter at or thomas ritter at 169 1998 2005 all rights reserved site created november 11 1998 last update january 3 2005 what s new about us our accomplishments photo gallery stallions at stud horses for sale training lessons clinics vacations apprentice program meet the horses calendar of events the store the magazine articles question and answer forum the newsletter discussion groups zen in the art of dressage links contact us home

www.adairmag.com/gordonadair/ recreation/sports sign up for our educational newsletter subscribe un subscribe tell your friends about this site info on service about gordon adair interview training programs and rates education you feel you are lacking can help video trainer gordon adair a video of your a list of concerns problems or questions you are adair will reply to you with advice on improving your relationship with your $49.95 per horse for more your concerns problems or questions to gordon will review the letter and schedule a time for your $49.95 per more information when i was under trainers i would ask why am i method over another their response was thatis just the way it is done i had learned many of the techniques required of training but because i never knew why the procedures where used i did not understand when or how often to use them this was like having all the required pieces of a puzzle but having no idea how to put them together to make the pretty picture there are many good trainers but few can explain their techniques that i would never say that is just the way it is done to my students i have formulated rules and techniques which can be used with other techniques to form a language when teaching i explain the concepts that people can relate to for better understanding training a horse is very rewarding but it does not compare to student and horse communicating well the ultimate reward is when a me of the compliments they have received by other horse to horses is thesame with every breed sex and riding style whether it be english western etc once you learn how to communicate with a horse all you needto do is pick a performance you are interested in then find the rule describes the performance and follow the guidelines this is why have or will change between horse breeds and divisions majority of my work is concentrated on teaching owners to philosophy of the horse and how to communicate with them once thisis achieved the owners can move on to specialized divisions of riding jumping dressage competitive mounted shooting team penning decide what program you need horse communication through trailer loading we have different degrees of horses available to learn with then you can apply your knowledge to your to maintain your horse this is a standard program for all lessons how much you want to learn is up to to train horses and teach students this is a standard program for all lessons how much you want to learn is up to be part of your horse s desensitizing program to eliminate the flight instinct of your horse this program encourages the development of your horse s covered in working achieve a higher level of respect from your horse with contact free leading requirements covered in saddle training learn how an inexperienced horse is started under saddle and the safe guards used for on the trail or in the arena the riding programs can be taught on the trail or in the riding level 1 and 2 learn different training procedures that will establish communication and aid you in achieving the hierarchy about gordon adair interview training programs and rates gordon s articles education center discussion www.positiveriding.com recreation/sports this page uses frames but your browser doesn t support them positive riding 99 offering over 65 combined years of equestrian and dressage experience henrik johansen ulla next major clinic coming up nbsp nbsp nbsp camp henrik at wildwood farm oak harbor wa nb sp nb sp nbsp session i july 6 10 2005 session ii july 19 23 2005 positive riding offers workshops clinics and continuous training for dressage instructors and riders we teach you a simple and logical system of training that adheres to the theories and philosophies of classical dressage while taking into account that the understanding of the natural abilities and the psyche of horse and rider are an essential part of this process for more detailed information please use the menu at left when we ride the horse in what we call the correct frame we must keep in mind that the frame should make it possible for the horse to stay in balance to feel as unrestricted as possible and to in every way be able to develop his talents to the maximum furthermore his confirmation level of training innate ability as well as the rider s ambitions must be taken into consideration the horse must work in a frame which allows it physically to do what we ask the horse should never feel handicapped by his frame for questions regarding this website mail copyright a9 2004 positive riding all rights reserved revised 2005 03 16

www.klassickur.com/ recreation/sports raising the bar raising the roof repeated her world cup success for the seventh time taking home the 2005 title and a ford pick up truck in the process the tightly constructed and well executed choreography to dreamy music with a french twist proved strong enough to overcome her fellow countryman and student edward gal who had won the grand prix and the favor the the audience just two days before but the story of the evening was debbie mcdonald and s rousing rock freestyle which brought the house down starting off in canter to the supreme s version of ain t no mountain high enough they proceeded to strut their walk to the sassy i m a woman next came the passage tour the mare shook her booty to a male voice crooning in the first and mmm mmm mmm in the second this created a ripple of giggles throughout the audience which in turn made debbie break into a huge grin in case anyone had not recognized the tune by that time the crooner broke into the lyric she s a brick house a totally appropriate song for this well built chick next the pointer sister s jump announced the trot by the time the duo hit their final centerline the introductory chords to respect had already rung out and the soulful lyric what you want baby i ve got launched the pair into their famous with a full pirouette some in the audience began to clap to the beat and as the girls transitioned to passage again the house began to rock debbie nodded her head as if to say go ahead clap and everyone joined in the fun before the final salute the crowd had already started to rise to its feet and as debbie punched her hand in the air signaling her pleasure the volume of claps and yells lifted the arena roof several inches they had done it the freestyle bar was raised not only for that evening but for years to come the magic s in the music in the infancy of fei k fcr competition few riders spent time in selecting precisely the right music and efforts at interpretation were minimal artistry improved over the years both in the choreography and in the selection and editing of music but s bonfire symphony 1996 olympic games opened a new door toward artistic perfection with music specifically written to match her choreography much the same way a soundtrack is written to match the action and emotion of a movie every change in movement had a corresponding change in music as well as having a shift in the character of the music from gait to gait the most noticeable difference between her music and the sound of the others was the integrity of the composition not only did footfalls match but coherent instrumentation logical key changes and graceful musical transitions created a wonderful unity the music chosen by riders in this year s world cup finals showed a wide range of types including movie themes new age symphonic rock light orchestral popular soul trance and broadway likewise a variety of music methods were employed to help riders achieve their goals four of the k carl hester guenter seidel leslie morse andreas appeared to be produced solely through the editing of master recordings all four programs had selections that connected together in some way that expressed the choreography and that were rewarded by the judges however the editing itself ranged from very choppy to quite elegant another method blended edited music with some midi instrumentation see ask terry music which was utilized mostly to mask bumpy transitions of the two who drew on this method sven resurrected his program from the 1996 games robert dover who originally had his composition specifically written for his athens performance appeared to have made changes to his choreography necessitating a change in the music structure the new version also used enhancements to the original recording the remaining six competitors danced to custom written compositions of them jan brink lone and hubertus schmidt reminded us that a strong beat makes it easy to see the relationship of music matching footfalls and also that sparse instrumentation can still be effective the final three truly deserved to be where they were not just because they demonstrated excellent execution but because they displayed superlative artistry as well the three engaging and diverse compositions were all commissioned gal s also incorporated already recorded trance music and included the same qualities of bonfire s symphony on top of that there was a richness of sound and a fullness of range that seemed to be missing from the other custom written arrangements the biggest advantage of this method is twofold to fit the music to the choreography as a well tailored suit fits a person and to establish musical integrity there still is a margin for error since a bobble in execution could set off the timing for the top three finalists though the performances were clean eloquent dramatic and reflected the riders international grand prix freestyle competition is an entity onto itself and to stand at the top means to be committed to a standard of excellence that exceeds what is expected in return for their commitment to their own high standards and because they managed to ride to their compositions so on that evening the final three riders were rewarded with combined artistic scores of 9 debbie mcdonald and her soul and funk program received two of them edward gal with his trance dance garnered three and and her french based theme earned an astonishing four all in all the were a joy to watch and were well received by the audience even the training day provided us all with a great world cup experience to punctuate the entertaining nature of the occasion we were treated to various las vegas acts over the four days including an elvis impersonator an arial team a pas de deux plus several other performances the city provided plenty of entertainment so even if you traveled by yourself there were lots of sights to see and things to do if you missed the world cup this year be sure to catch it when it is broadcast on the outdoor life network oln on june 6 at 4 00 p.m it is definitely worth the time the paris south strip spiral escalator caesars palace the mirage the venetian north strip viva las vegas a9 2005 kur all rights reserved terry gallo 407 977 7070 what is a kur b7 who is kur design b7 clinics b7 tips b7 ask terry photo gallery b7 archive debbie mcdonald signs a model of bob mcdonald and terry gallo of kur chat with people at the dressage unlimited breakfast the overhead electronic scoreboard kept everyone up to date on the scores the scoreboard shows sponsor karin reid congratulating debbie takes a ride on the back of her new ford truck saturday s entertainment before the presentation of awards

www.rycroft-equitation.co.uk/ recreation/sports rycroft approved by the british horse society as an examination and training centre welcome home 9658 facilities activities training bhs courses younger riders future events contact rycroft pictures finding us rycroft is a professional family run riding school which has been established for 30 years we are approved by the british horse society as an examination and training centre and specialise in helping clients to achieve the exacting standards needed to pass bhs exams our experienced instructors together with a stable of some 40 quality horses and ponies enable us to cater for a wide range of needs from beginners to advanced career students for those whose main interest is riding for pleasure we provide first rate horses and a perfect location for maximum enjoyment directors mr mrs w hundley rycroft education limited new mill lane hampshire tel 0118 973 2761
fhfarm.com recreation/sports site map home about us programs with horses vacation rental gallery contact it was from them that i first learned of the intelligence that lurks in nonhuman nature the ability that an alien form of sentience has to echo one 92s own to instill a reverberation in oneself that temporarily shatters habitual ways of seeing and feeling leaving one open to a world all alive awake and aware david abram the spell of the sensuous a tribute to clancy farm life tours intentional leadership there are many different aspects to this beautiful place in sebastopol west sonoma county california first and foremost it is a 23 acre mostly wild land we have invited the wildlife to be at home here and for that reason you will often be able to see deer racoon bobcat and fox playing in the air currents above the land on a daily basis are the graceful turkey vultures chatty red shoulder hawks and reserved confident red tail hawks all visitors are welcome to enjoy the private walking trails that wind through the forest oak groves and meadows on the property there is a spacious turn key vacation rental well placed at the top of the property for gorgeous sunset views this home is surrounded with lush landscape including a small waterfall and fish pond that can be heard from the wisteria covered patio and from the kitchen as well as two of the bedrooms the hot tub is nestled beneath majestic oaks where privacy is assured and views abound inside this 3 bedroom 2 bath house there are seven comfortable beds 2 queens 1 double and 4 twins easily sleeping up to ten people the kitchen is fully equipped and there are three dining areas from which to choose in the living room and master bedroom there are bookshelves filled with interesting books and magazines to further entertain you there is a full video library stereo video games and satellite tv there are children s books puzzles and board games provided too upon arrival you will drive down your private drive and find the key waiting for you inside you will find a bowl of fresh organic eggs from our own hens locally baked organic bread coffee tea butter and jam on the table is a complimentary bottle of local wine the best of sonoma county awaits you here one of the most attractive activities here at full house farm revolves around the horses whether you are just visiting or would like to become a regular student harmony with horses is designed to educate kids from 2 92 with the horses being the real teachers and life coach christine cole skillfully guiding students there are mentoring programs for kids and inspiring life changing programs for adults this is not your ordinary horseback riding experience but rather a journey into the language of the horse christine s 30 years of coaching is a rare find unique in it s depth and insight besides the horses there are sheep chickens and rabbits tours are available for small and large groups you can learn about micro farming organic foods and sustainable living there are picnic facilities if you are planning just a visit for the day rather than an overnight stay so whether you are seeking an outing with your family a special vacation or an experience with horses that matches no other there is something here for you copyright a9 2004 full house farm photos copyright a9 2004 barbara bourne photography all rights reserved web site maintenance top of page

east of the historic town of galena illinois shenandoah riding center is the place to go this northwestern portion of illinois has one of the most exquisite terrains in all of illinois the rolling hills woods and open valleys make a perfect setting for trail riding shenandoah riding center offers 40 miles of groomed trails that run through the most scenic part of jo daviess county you can ride and ride and ride .. come as a group a family or a couple to enjoy shenandoah s beautifully maintained marked trails attend one of shenandoah s many clinics held throughout the year or ride the cross country course while you re in the area enjoy hours of shopping the historic town in galena or golf at one of eagle ridge inn and resort s four magnificent golf courses stay at one of the many resort homes b b s inns motels or hotels located in the area pamper your horse by boarding him her at shenandoah riding center overnight your horse will think he she is getting a dream vacation and so will www.100horsepicks.com/ recreation/sports if you enjoy horses and horse racing then your at the right place thoroughbred horse racing picks and horse race handicapping and gambling tips 100 horse picks horse racing is among the most widely attended u.s spectator sports it is also a major professional sport in canada great britain ireland western europe australia new zealand south africa and south america the most popular form of the sport is the racing of mounted thoroughbred horses over flat courses at distances from three quarters of a mile to two miles horse racing s beginnings can be traced back to the 12th century when english knights returned home from the crusades with arab horses over the next 400 years breeding between imported arab stallions and english mares produced horses that combined speed and endurance horse racing became a professional sport as early as 1702 to 1714 racecourses sprang up all over england and offered large purses to attract the best horses the british settlers brought horses and horse racing to america with the first american racetrack built in long island in 1665 the development of organized racing did not arrive to america until after the civil war in 1894 the american jockey club was formed to govern the sport the introduction of pari mutuel betting for the kentucky derby signaled a renaissance for the sport after stumbling badly in the early 1900s at the end of world war i prosperity brought spectators flocking to racetracks the sport prospered until world war ii declined in popularity during the 1950s and 1960s enjoyed a resurgence in the 1970s and declined in the late 1980s it is currently enjoying another renaissance thanks to the popularity of horses like war emblem funny cide and the legendary seabiscuit today thoroughbred tracks exist in about half the states in the united states public interest in the sport focuses primarily on major thoroughbred races such as the triple crown kentucky derby preakness belmont stakes and the breeders cup home horse racing harness racing the best place to bet on horse racing 100 horse picks las vegas nv 89102 copyright a9 2002 2004 all rights reserved questions or comments to

credit they turned it around in the second scoring five tries the only try in the first half try went to while in the second half manu scored a double and clinton and todd byrne touched down before obituary paul jeffreys arnold and charlotte source nz herald paul squeeze jeffreys was a shining example to new zealanders trying to turn their health around the medical director of the new zealand nutrition foundation says the man who transformed his size and health in 12 months losing died last week aged 44 his unexpected death came after surgery at auckland hospital late last week to remove a benign brain tumour it was a great shock to us all professor cliff tasman jones said of mr jeffreys death he was so full of life and he really kept his weight down jeffreys was in good spirits after the surgery when he spoke to david walden a close friend and ceo of tbwa the next night he had a seizure and slipped into a coma from which he never recovered walden said posted by dave on monday mail please include your name bidder number item numbers dollar amount of bids if you would like to check on current high bids or would like a better description of an item please call 910 270 7738 rather than e mail or fax requesting a bidder number if you are a new bidder requesting a bidder number i must have your name real address and phone number before assigning a bidder number e mail address 1 names and all other information on auction participants is strictly confidential 2 you may bid by either mail phone fax e mail or all 4 if two or more mail bids on the same item result in a tie and no one tops these bids by phone fax or e mail the one with the earliest postmark gets the item all mail bids must be received by saturday april 23 2005 all fax e mail bids must be received by 5 00 p.m saturday april 23 2005 you may also leave a maximum bid amount example current bid is $25.00 you can raise it to $27.00 but leave a maximum bid of $45.00 that will be used in increments only as needed 3 phone bidding is designed to make the auction as close as possible to an auction that you would attend in person phone bidding can be used in various ways a you can call to see where you stand on items that you submitted mail e mail or fax bids on given this information you can either increase your bid s or stand pat b if you forgot to submit a bid sheet or at the last minute decide to bid on an item you can do so by phone please have your bidder number and item numbers ready when bidding by phone 910 270 7738 you may call fax or e mail your bids in anytime bidding starts march 30th final night phone bidding saturday april 23rd from 5 00 p.m east coast time until the phone does not ring for 5 minutes or no bid is raised for 5 minutes when this occurs the auction is over the last 3 auctions have ended between 12 30 a.m 1 15 a.m sunday morning east coast time for those that have had trouble getting through the busiest time seems to be between 10 00 p.m 12 00 a.m 4 the suggested bid ranges see below are provided as a guide and are based on past auction results and malloy s sports collectibles 1993 value guide items may sell for above or below their code range bid code ranges a $10.00 to $25.00 b $26.00 to $50.00 c $51.00 to $100.00 d to $250.00 e over $250.00 5 all bids must be in whole dollars no cents to protect bidders and consignors we reserve the right to not accept certain bids examples of bids that will not be accepted a bids that are less than $10.00 b offers to top all bids 6 phone bid increases will be accepted in the following minimum increments current bid $10.00 to $50.00 $2.00 increase $51.00 to $100.00 $3.00 increase to $200.00 $5.00 increase over $200.00 $10.00 increase the above increments will double at 12 00 a.m sunday morning april 24th 7 invoices will be sent out within 2 days of the end of the auction invoices will include a shipping and insurance charge minimum $3.00 prices realized list will be sent free to all successful bidders only along with invoices payments must be received within 10 days of receipt of invoice items will be shipped in the order that payments are received pay by personal check money order or cashiers check make checks payable to dick hering 8 items are returnable in same condition as sent within 5 days of receipt if they are not as described if items are damaged in shipping report claims to us and either ups rps or the u.s postal service 9 all bids are final once a bid has been made it can not be retracted questions dick hering 910 270 7738 anytime fax 910 270 7739 e mail back to top condition all glasses are in either mint or near mint condition unless described otherwise all decanters are empty and in excellent condition all miscellaneous non paper items are in excellent condition unless otherwise described all miscellaneous paper items with the exception of programs are used but in very good to excellent clean condition unless otherwise noted programs are graded on the following scale mint unused excellent in most cases a program that has slight cover blemishes or flaws but in some cases may have light writing inside very good a program that may have slight cover blemishes writing or flaws but will have light to medium writing inside good a used program in average condition with medium to heavy writing inside and may have some writing on cover dick hering 311 drive hampstead nc phone 910 270 7738 fax 910 270 7739 e mail back to top

www.missinglink.com/ recreation/sports the missing link the resource for thoroughbred racing and handicapping software p.o box san jose ca 1700 408 223 voice mail who are we simply speaking the missing link is the source of the most widely used thoroughbred handicapping programs in america we have been publishing software for the serious handicapper since 1988 chances are unless you are an existing customer you ve never heard of us however oh well.. until now the web our advertising has been limited to word of mouth our philosophy we believe that our mission is to offer tools for the serious handicapper as opposed to cranking out methods that will ultimately fail our tools are all based on scientifically validated research that has withstood the test of time for example our impact value based tools have been scientifically validated since 1979 our tools also permit you the handicapper to remain in control unlike other systems that lock you into a particular mindless lock step method our tools allow you to adjust your betting styles to your track s preferred race types and so on we believe that if you are looking for a magic bullet then you should look elsewhere or try the lottery did we mention that our most popular program is nearly free see the overview.. questions merely click here to send us an e mail if you wish to be added to our priority e mailing list and receive automatic notifications via email please state so in your request please include your human name and snail mail address.. if we do not answer your email within three working days then our reply may have bounced in that case please send us another email containing your current email address a brief overview product catalog what s new if you are experiencing problems with plus v check our faq frequently asked questions shortcut to our ftp directory more interesting places.. american turf description american turf monthly has helped pick winners for six decades the monthly magazine nurtures racing fans along the path to becoming confident handicappers 0151 racetrack investors unpretentious articles about angles the best ways to decipher class in the thoroughbred horses to watch money management and high tech handicapping in the 90s make readers more successful last updated july 10 1999

retired racehorses and pictures from the kentucky derby breeders cup and rolex 3 day event for information on services you can send email to call us at 1 800 891 3227 or visit our how to page we advertise horses for sale make horse sale videos design customized web sites advertise horse related products or services and provide computer consulting services we emphasize personal service from horse professionals thereby setting inc apart from the many do it yourself classified ad sites available on the internet we keep our focus on horse related businesses because we believe our customers are best served by a company that understands their business this intimate understanding of what it s like to own train breed show race buy and sell horses is what enables us to make advertising simple and free of stress for our customers because of our location in the thoroughbred rich state of kentucky many of the horses on this site are thoroughbreds but we also list quarter horses paint horses warmbloods and other breeds such as morgan horses american saddlebred horses tennessee walking horses arabians and ponies in all ages price ranges and levels of training we emphasize the sport in categories not the breed we advertise horses located in every part of north america and occasionally in other parts of the world visit often because new horses are listed regularly race horses 5c www.cyberstable.com/ recreation/sports the splash page queen of country the s valley down the stretch at the by monica effects by the was formed through the internet in 1996 to purchase own and race standardbred horses this website served as a means of communication for the members and friends of and its successor stables all the stables are registered as limited partnerships in ontario and with the united states trotting association and the canadian trotting association all of the stables discussed herein have been dissolved for historical purposes you may continue to read our site and our story you may learn more about our great sport through these great harness links whitby ontario webmaster at dot com copyright 1997 2000 site developed by the group web space by

she is relative to the rest of the world s population link the indispensable steve clemons provides a remarkable update on the bolton affair with an assist from sidney blumenthal here is a hint of just how serious and far reaching the matter has become the white house may be deploying new and cynical tactics but those moderate republicans and progressives working behind the scenes as sid blumenthal points out are profoundly resolved to restore integrity to american foreign policy and to protect the system of checks and balances that are being smeared and violated by the cheney bolton machine the full post can be found here once again his remarkable skills in a recent post relating to the influence of leo strauss on the neocon movement as usual his incisive commentary is laced with biting humor what strikes me most about the ndash and by extension the neocons ndash is that they rsquo ve pushed the traditional liberal conservative dichotomy of american politics back about 150 years and moved it roughly 4 000 miles to the east to the far side of the rhine river their grand existential struggle isn rsquo t with the likes of teddy kennedy or even franklin d roosevelt it rsquo s with the liberalism of voltaire john locke and john stuart mill ndash not to mention the author of the declaration of the independence the full post is well worth reading and can be found here eli sums it up well the power of the state today april 26th the final report on the state of wmd in iraq was released there were none since 1992 we ve all known that for quite some time of course but the release of the final report is an occasion to reflect on the meaning of all this iraq had not had any weapons of mass destruction since 1992 yet in 2003 eleven years later the power of the u.s government combined with or perhaps using is a better word the power of the media in the complete absence of anything remotely resembling proof which would have been impossible since what they were trying to prove wasn t actually true was enough to convince a substantial portion of the american public not to mention many though certainly not a majority of the world s governments that iraq not only had weapons of mass destruction but that they had them in such quantities and were such an imminent danger that even though u.n inspectors were still busy verifying what this report confirms two years later it was necessary to immediately invade and overthrow the government of that country and if the government and media can do that they can pretty much do anything they want when and if the u.s government decides they need to bomb iran or invade syria or blockade north korea or sponsor a coup in venezuela they ll turn up the verbal heat and in no time the bogeyman du jour will be established and that s why independent media is so important because it s one of the necessary links in the only chain that can put a stop to this madness of course people who listen to and learn from independent media and act on what they know is another necessary link his blog left i on the news can be found here it s plum gill and mary peabody s substantial not to mention friendly cat he likes to rest often and has developed a strong preference for down as his choice of bedding if you happen to travel to and need a reliable hairdresser you might want to consider the above salon which is more the story or the fact that it appeared in a u.k paper and not to my knowledge in any major u.s paper click here mikhail petrov is the photographer who took the above photo he has some other interesting shots especially of russian cities the one above is of saint petersburg on a contax users site found here one of the most obvious symptoms of the diseased state of our political system is the perverted relationship between the mainstream press and the current administration it is tempting to cite a lack of journalistic integrity as the source of the problem but without excusing the individual reporters the problem stems principally from the insidious symbiosis which exists between corporate media and the white house an especially nauseating example of this relationship are the so called press briefings given regularly by the white house the questions posed are by in large carefully formulated to assure the favored position of the reporter and more importantly his or her media outlet any serious attempt to learn something or god forbid challenge the administration s actions or policies are very rare the press secretary will either respond to the softball questions in fashion spouting the day s talking points or will duck dive or obfuscate when hit with an all to rare tough question there is however one glorious exception to this otherwise predictably depressing spectacle helen thomas the 84 year old veteran white house correspondent is the only member of the press corp who regularly fires off serious direct and from the administration s standpoint inflammatory questions today was classic q back to the report on the botched wmd intelligence have the massive intelligence failures documented in the report caused the president to rethink his policy of preventive war mr mcclellan you know september 11th taught us a very important lesson and that lesson was that we must confront threats before it is too late if we had known of those attacks ahead of time we would have moved heaven and earth to prevent them from happening this president will not hesitate when it comes to protecting the american people and in the post september 11th world that we live in the consequences of underestimating the threat we face is too high it s tens of possibly tens of thousands of lives q what about the cost of mr mcclellan are you talking about the iraq situation q going into iraq yes with bad intelligence mr mcclellan i think we ve talked about this before the world is safer with saddam hussein s regime removed from power the iraqi people are serving as an example to the rest of the middle east through their courage and determination to build a free future q the ones that are alive you mean juan cole provides a blistering and incisive critique of bush s recent speech this campaign is not really about life at all as the examples of the raped woman or the woman whose pregnancy puts her life in danger demonstrate it is about control and the imposition of a minority s values on others and that is why the iraq war is the perfect symbol for the anti abortionists colonial conquest is always a kind of rape but now the conquered country must bear the fetus of bush imposed liberty to term the hierarchy is thus established washington is superior to baghdad and iraq is and deprived of certain kinds of choices the full post can be found here one of the very best bloggers in my view is back in business as he calls himself was never really out of business but he did reduce his production to a trickle for a while he s back now post in which he justifiably the washington post my favorite part is in order to illustrate a point his use of an old dilbert comic strip dogbert now the first thing you need to understand is that past performance is no guarantee of future results client ok so what s your investment strategy dogbert i m going to take all your money and buy myself a luxury condo in cancun client has that strategy ever worked before dogbert jeez it s like i m talking to a wall here s blog can be found here this type of obfuscation on the part of the government is truly outrageous there was an outcry when the so called rfid chips were under consideration for use in u.s passports these chips like those in ez pass type car toll devices allow a remote sensor to read information imbedded in the chip the government initially appeared to have backed down but it now looks as if they simply decided to use a similar technology ndash which in effect does the same thing ndash and to re name it the full report from wired can be found here excellent work by steve clemons steve clemons has single handedly produced ample reasons why john bolton s nomination as ambassador to the u.n should be rejected he recently reprinted an eloquent letter signed by 59 former ambassadors many of whom worked for republican administrations urging the chairman of the senate foreign relations committee to do just that read the letter here this weeks corporate responsibility prize winner burger king they now proudly offer the enormous omelet sandwich which apparently consists of one sausage patty two eggs two american cheese slices and three strips of bacon on a bun the introduction of this 730 calorie classic caused the following reaction from morgan spurlock who ridiculed mcdonald s in super size me it should come with a $5 off coupon for your first angioplasty in fairness though burger king s healthy breakfast treat has only about half of the calories of hardee s and carl s jr 1 420 calorie monster full article for those who care can be found here a damning summary of alan greenspan s career.. or more accurately of the monumental he has made during his career can be found here thanks to the cunning realist i ve long been attracted to indian miniature paintings it s not so much the precision with which they were obviously crafted but more the composition and brilliant use of color which appeals to me most the above example dates from the mid 18th century further details on this piece can be found at sotheby s where it will be auctioned there are several interesting examples to be found among the 13 things that do not make sense posted at newscientist.com my favorite happens to be 4 belfast homeopathy results madeleine ennis a pharmacologist at queen s university belfast was the scourge of homeopathy she railed against its claims that a chemical remedy could be diluted to the point where a sample was unlikely to contain a single molecule of anything but water and yet still have a healing effect until that is she set out to prove once and for all that homeopathy was in her most recent paper ennis describes how her team looked at the effects of ultra dilute solutions of histamine on human white blood cells involved in inflammation these basophils release histamine when the cells are under attack once released the histamine stops them releasing any more the study replicated in four different labs found that homeopathic solutions so dilute that they probably didn t contain a single histamine molecule worked just like histamine ennis might not be happy with the homeopaths claims but she admits that an effect cannot be ruled out read the rest of this as well as the other examples here i have the impression that many internet users are slow to recognize let alone realize the potential of internet radio access if you like good radio whether it be talk news or music but are tired of your current limited options you re in for a treat bear in mind though that decent or better yet good speakers will greatly enhance the experience the array of station options is staggering but you might want to start with the bbc which like npr not only offers fine programs but also links to individual segments one easy way to organize the stations and or individual shows is to use realplayer and simply save them as favorites the bbc radio home page can be found here the link for this american life an exceptionally creative and often very interesting npr show can be found here if you haven t seen john bolton the man nominated to to be the next ambassador to the u.n in action.. take a look at this frank rich writes thoughtfully on the schiavo affair within hours he bush turned ms schiavo into a slick applause line at a social security rally it is wise to always err on the side of life he said wisdom that apparently had not occurred to him in 1999 when he mocked the failed pleas for clemency of karla faye tucker the born again texas death row inmate in a magazine interview with tucker carlson read the article here interested in washington politics josh marshall and steve clemons are in my view the best bloggers reporting regularly on washington politics the information found in their blogs is both vastly superior to and more honest than what one finds with few exceptions in the mainstream media furthermore they are both careful and remarkably fair given their obvious partisan leanings in a recent post clemons offers a damning insite into why bolton is such an outrageous and bad choice as ambassador to the u.n to read the post click here i suspect that this discovery is likely many years from now to be considered revolutionary in that it will have altered so many fundamental assumptions in a discovery that has flabbergasted geneticists researchers have shown that plants can overwrite the genetic code they inherit from their parents and revert to that of their grandparents link to the full article from nature it is remarkable how the liberal ny times allows reporters like judith miller and adam to author front page stories who better to expose the latter s recent work than jw in a polarizing case jeb bush cements his political stature reads the times hed the headline could have read blah blah blah jeb bush raises his political visibility that s neutral sounding accurate but by using the statesmanlike word stature the hed makes it sound as if jeb bush is having a profile in courage crisis moment with the terri schiavo case when more likely he and his brother have blundered through but let that go for the moment now isn t responsible for the headline of course but it s faithful to the awed gulp of his latest exhibition in political naivete here s a link to wolcott s full post the most acerbic political cartoonist i ve come across weighs in on the schiavo frenzy to view the whole strip and many more click here almost always a the site is called veiled conceit and the author mocks those who advertise their weddings in the ny times this is from a recent post zachary is a lot of things he s short in both body and personality he s a new york native he s a fledging filmmaker he s not necessarily emotionally available he s quirky he s a strong stoic intellect in two words though i d say he s woefully self aware it s worth reading the whole thing straight pasterns then and now it is unusual to find a horse which has close to perfect conformation the vast majority have flaws of some sort but most horses and their owners live with those flaws without suffering in any meaningful sense in the world of thoroughbred racing however conformation flaws take on much greater importance as the animals are so fragile and put under such tremendous stress many flaws are acceptable as racehorses can and often do compensate well enough to overcome them there are a few flaws though which are unacceptable as they are almost certain to prevent a racehorse from standing up to the rigors of training and racing one such flaw truly one of the very worst is when a horse is found to be straight through the pasterns this refers to the angle of the the bone which connects the hoof to the ankle on the front legs the ideal angle is 45 deg and provides excellent shock absorption for the front legs which take the brunt of the physical stress as the body weight is not equally distributed when a racehorse is even somewhat straight through the pasterns that shock absorbing capability is severely reduced so that the shock from the concussion of running is transmitted right up to the ankle and knee joints as you might imagine those joints are not designed to handle that level of stress which is why racehorses with this flaw rarely remain sound the photo above a beautiful 7th 8th century tang dynasty pottery figure is a classic example of a horse with straight pasterns of course the animal it was modeled after was not a racehorse and presumably those types lived very productive lives in spite of that kind flaw if you like the model feel free to bid at christie s on march 30th full description of the piece at christie s remember the outrage spewed toward those who wondered whether the iraq war was really about oil from greg palast one of the better investigative reporters who like seymour hersh writes for the guardian uk because the american newspapers apparently can t stomach the harsh truth link to article like him or not.. while he deserves plenty of criticism bobby knight is a very interesting character and quite probably cares much more about the overall development of his players than most coaches from today s ny times it seemed that the only person who could get to knight besides his wife was a former walk on ronald ross started his college career without a scholarship became texas tech s star point guard and drained the game winning 3 pointer with 1 minute 10 seconds remaining i ve never had a player i ve admired more than ronald ross knight said and particularly when he hit that 3 today knight has never bestowed such flattery in person on ross who led the raiders with 24 points but his affection for him is obvious when ross was asked about his coach s influence knight tapped him on the shoulder and whispered an answer in his ear he s like a latter day santa claus ross mimicked home about me racehorses contact books absolutely right does that mean you won t be satisfied with a handicapping method that picks 7 of 10 winners on average in playable races most handicappers are thrilled to have 3 winners on a day s xtreme horse racing 2 gamble online 4 online gaming emerald gaming offshore gambling sites change a wager handicapping visit our horse handicapping school and learn everything you need to know about horse racing handicapping just click here bookmakers and gambling agents take advantage of our new price per head bookmaking services is the most complete directory on all horse racing related material online you can find from the basics of racing tracks wagering basics and tips to the most complete information to bet on horse tracks and events such as the breeders cup and the triple crown horses and jockeys biographies together with info on the most important races is not to be left behind so come on in and surf through our site we assure you ll be an expert on horse racing by the time you are over we are also inviting you to take a look at major racebooks and to try their gambling promotions for this 2004 breeders cup the origins of modern horse racing lie in the 12th century when english knights returned from the crusades with swift arab horses over the next 400 years an increasing number of arab stallions were imported and bred to english mares to produce horses that combined speed and endurance matching the fastest of these animals in two horse races for a private wager became a popular diversion of the nobility to find more on the origins of horse racing enter here the british settlers brought horses and horse racing with them to the new world with the first racetrack laid out on long island as early as 1665 the rapid growth of the sport without any central governing authority led to the domination of many tracks by criminal elements in 1894 the nation s most prominent track and stable owners met in new york to form an american jockey club modeled on the english which soon ruled racing with an iron hand and eliminated much of the corruption more tracks opened as many state legislatures agreed to legalize pari mutuel betting in exchange for a share of the money wagered at the end of world war i prosperity and great horses like man o war brought spectators flocking to racetracks the sport prospered until world war ii declined in popularity during the 1950s and 1960s then enjoyed a resurgence in the 1970s triggered by the immense popularity of great horses such as secretariat seattle slew and affirmed each winners of the american triple crown for more on horse racing in the united states click here gambling on the outcome of horse races has been an integral part of the appeal of the sport since prehistory and today is the sole reason horse racing has survived as a major professional sport all betting at american tracks today is done under the pari mutuel wagering system under this system a fixed percentage of the total amount wagered is taken out for track operating expenses racing purses and state and local taxes the remaining sum is divided by the number of individual wagers to determine the payoff or return on each bet the difficult art of predicting the winner of a horse race is called handicapping the process of handicapping involves evaluating the demonstrated abilities of a horse in light of the conditions under which it will be racing on a given day for more on horse racing gambling click here enjoy our horse games and don t forget to check out our breeders cup section races breeders cup triple crown belmont stakes kentucky derby preakness stakes dubai world cup hong kong cup japan cup melbourne cup prix de l arc de triomphe royal ascot handicappers absolute picks babes picks genius sports rocketman today 2nd race winner on top 4th race $10 exacta in our top 2 5th race winner picked 2nd 7th race best bet won and we had $25 to win on him in the bag of gold august 12 2003 it is with terrible sadness that i inform you martin dermer my dad my best friend and the greatest handicapper in the world passed away from complications from cancer as many of you know over the past year he battled several health issues during this time we began to transition the daily activities of the sheet to a new handicapper curt curt is marty s longtime handicapping partner and dear friend he worked closely with marty and myself with the understanding that curt and i would eventually take over marty was bedridden for the past couple of weeks and curt and i have been publishing the sheet since that time for those of you that had the pleasure to meet marty you probably heard him brag about my abilities as a handicapper of course he may have been a little biased regarding me but i can say he held curt in even higher regard racing digest has been published every race day without exception for the past 20 years and its history and success will continue long into the future we promise that marty s memory and great tradition will be kept alive with the exception of a new email address and possibly a new phone number the site will not change we will all miss marty dearly feel free to email me at if you have any questions or simply wish to pass on your thoughts this site really does have the world s greatest customers thank you all for being such wonderful customers and friends sincerely marc our contact information email 314 583 8564 notices important notice to all members when you log in your username must be all lowercase note that this is not the case for your password martin dermer s racing digest will be covering the full california horse racing circuit during calendar year 2003 based on the following schedule 2003 california horse racing circuit santa anita december 26 april 21 hollywood park april 23 july 20 del mar july 23 september 10 santa anita october 1 november 2 hollywood park november 11 december 21 martin dermer previous winner of the world handicapping championship at caesar s palace in las vegas has been the track handicapper at arlington international racecourse for the past 26 years dermer s handicapping expertise has been featured on abc and cbs television sports shows and in numerous newspaper and magazine articles he has been the track handicapper at sportsman s park and hawthorne race track and has handicapped for the chicago sun times and chicago tribune newspapers this same expertise is now at hollywood park del mar thoroughbred club and santa anita park note picks for the current day s races are not guaranteed to be available on the site until 9 00 am pacific coast time hollywood park picks are not guaranteed to be available until noon pacific coast time on the nights they race subscribe now for dermer s horse racing picks at santa anita park del mar and hollywood park we are now set up to accept your subscription by secure credit card page maintained by inc
